instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2533 on fire!
threads.message: hello guys as soon as i plug the charger i see vapor and Is like want to become on  fire I unplug really quick the charger , well I have on my hands a board with damage on one cap going inside the board that is giving ground to PPBUS_G3H , any way to solution something like that?

threads.title: 820-2533 on fire!
threads.message: Depends on how much damage it have...... My advice: to the pile for parts...

threads.title: 820-2533 on fire!
threads.message:
This one went on fire and still works to this day. [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=81kmdfdLuag[/url]

Don't let fire discourage you. Where is the short?

threads.title: 820-2533 on fire!
threads.message: Depends on where the damage is and how bad it is. On and old board like this it may not be worth the effort.

threads.title: 820-2533 on fire!
threads.message: I saw the video man that's crazy !  the short is on PPBUS_3GH then the solution to that is lift all the components on that line that are connected and connect then to the wire right? my power is not that great yet to to that on PPBUS_3GH.

threads.title: 820-2533 on fire!
threads.message: Find the short first, let's not jump to conclusions that it is in the board until that is confirmed. Inject 1v and see what happens.
